input.description: access key [Optional] The AWS access key.
secret key [Optional] The AWS secret access key.

session token [Optional] : The AWS session token which is generally created for temporary access to users for role based authorization.
Please Note: The temporary access key , secret key and session token to be generated by the user to provide in adapter request.
Please refer below AWS docs for more details
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp_request.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/sts/assume-role.html
region [Optional] The region to communicate with.

size [Optional]
The size of the volume, in GiBs. Required if you are not creating a volume from a snapshot.
Valid Values: 1 -1024
Note: If the volume is created from a snapshot,then specifying a size greater than that of the snapshot will increase the size of the volume, specifying a smaller size will not have any impact.

snapshot id [Optional]
The snapshot from which to create the new volume.
Note: One of the parameters - 'size' and 'snapshot-id' is required.

volume-type [Optional]
The type of the Volume to be created.
Valid values: standard (default), io1

iops [Optional]
The values of 'iops' for this volume.

availability zone [Mandatory]
The Availability Zone in which to create the new volume.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <amazon-ec2-rest-request> <xsl:if test="string-length('${access key}')>0"> <access-key>${access key}</access-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${secret key}')>0"> <secret-key>${secret key}</secret-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${session token}')>0 and string-length('${secret key}')>0 and string-length('${access key}')>0"> <session-token>${session token}</session-token> </xsl:if> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">create-volume</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string-length('${region}')>0"> <region>${region}</region> </xsl:if> <parameters> <xsl:if test="string-length('${size}')>0"> <size>${size}</size> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${snapshot id}')>0"> <snapshot-id>${snapshot id}</snapshot-id> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${volume type}')>0"> <volume-type>${volume type}</volume-type> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${iops}')>0"> <iops>${iops}</iops> </xsl:if> <availability-zone>${availability zone}</availability-zone> </parameters> </amazon-ec2-rest-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Creates a new Amazon EBS volume to which any Amazon EC2 instance can attach within the same Availability Zone.
